98730.name: Number of years as aid orphan (2006-2016)
98730.description: Number of years in the period from 2006 to 2016 that a country has been defined by the OECD as a 'top aid orphan'.

display.name: Number of years as aid orphan

source.name: Aid Orphans (OECD, 2018)
source.dataPublishedBy: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
source.additionalInfo:
Countries defined as 'aid orphans' by the OECD are those which are are "underfunded" by need relative to others. This is assessed on the basis of multiple aid allocation models: the Egalitarian, Performance-based allocation (PBA), UNDP, and Collier-Dollar poverty allocation (CD) model.

The 'top orphan' countries in a given year are defined here as those identified as underfunded on the basis of 3 or more of the allocation models.

Aid orphans are assessed annually from 2006 to 2016.
